description:
Application to vary the wording of condition 2  of planning permission  P092306 dated 13 August 2010 for the Restoration of St. David's Church (Westbourne Road) including external and internal alterations to provide a total of 1455 square metres of community and worship space (Class D1), representing an overall increase of 612 square metres, in addition to a one bedroom residential unit, within the church building. The demolition of the church hall (Lough Road) and the erection of a seven storey building (plus basement), comprising 40 flats, and the construction of a separate two storey (plus basement) vicarage building comprising a four bedroom residential unit.  Associated landscaping and communal courtyard, accessed from Lough Road.

Current application seeks to substitute new plans and supporting information comprising the following changes to the scheme:
(a) An increase in height of the new proposed building by circa 825mm. (b) Associated revisions to levels and access at ground floor level.
decision_conditions:
CONDITION:  The development hereby permitted shall be begun not later than the expiration of expiry date of original permission being 13 August 2013.

REASON: To ensure the commencement timescale for the development is not extended beyond that of the original planning permission granted on 13 August 2010 [LBI ref: P092306].  Furthermore, to comply with the provisions of Section 91(1)(a) of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 as amended by the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004 (Chapter 5).
